CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this stream chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Mobile Users relative to Free Users?
SRP.A: Mobile Users is {below} Free Users in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Free Users relative to Mobile Users?
SRP.A: Free Users is {above} Mobile Users in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total average watch time?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Mobile Users}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total average watch time?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Free Users}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Free Users's maximum Average Watch Time in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Free Users's maximum Average Watch Time is in {1980}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Mobile Users's minimum Average Watch Time in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Mobile Users's minimum Average Watch Time is in {1975}.

NC.Q: Between 1980 and 1985, was the average total Average Watch Time higher or lower than between 1978 and 1985?
NC.A: The average total average watch time between 1980 and 1985 was {higher} than between 1978 and 1985.

NC.Q: Was the total Average Watch Time in 1978 higher or lower than in 1985?
NC.A: The total average watch time in 1978 was {lower} than in 1985.

NC.Q: Was the total Average Watch Time in 1975 higher or lower than in 1976?
NC.A: The total average watch time in 1975 was {lower} than in 1976.

NC.Q: Was the total Average Watch Time in 1980 higher or lower than in 1985?
NC.A: The total average watch time in 1980 was {lower} than in 1985.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, which one held the dominant position for the longest period of time?
MSR.A: {Mobile Users} held the dominant position for the longest period of time.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, in which year did Free Users and Mobile Users first exchange dominant positions?
MSR.A: Free Users and Mobile Users first exchanged leading positions in {1975}.
